intro: Narcissus perez-chiscanoi, commonly known as the Canary Islands daffodil, is a rare and endemic species native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-like corona. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is closely related to other daffodil species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
